reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

description.narrative: Kosovo - Tuberculosis - Community Development Fund - CDF. This program has the following goals: To reduce the overall incidence of notified cases from 40.6 per 100,000 in 2017 to 34 per 100,000 in 2021 and maintain tuberculosis mortality in Kosovo below 2/100,000.. The objectives of this program are: Successfully treat all cases of tuberculosis and maintain at least 85% the treatment success rate.. Strengthen the early prevention and detection of tuberculosis by intensifying the active and passive findings of the cases by providing quality services and adequate measures of infection control and LTBI treatment of cases and other ongoing support.. Establish and support national-level policies and legal framework and ensure greater government political and financial commitment to effective TB response in Kosovo. Improving patient-centred tuberculosis care through increased CSO engagement and strengthening public-private partnership. Improve national capacity to investigate and assess the impact of tuberculosis control and pre-elimination of interventions.

title.narrative: Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
TB I-Other 1: MDR TB prevalence among previously treated TB patients
TB I-Other 1: RR/MDR TB prevalence among previously treated TB patients
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
